intro: Gymnadeniopsis replicata, commonly known as the clustered false dragonhead, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. Gymnadeniopsis replicata has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive, fragrant scent.
